name: fawningly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that praises someone too much and gives them a lot of attention that is not sincere in order to get a positive reaction: The fan told her fawningly that he loved everything that she had ever done. I don't like how the royal family are so fawningly adored, no matter what they do or say.
More examplesFewer examplesDespite having had an extremely successful career, she remains fawningly subservient when she meets members of the nobility. The Prime Minister's adviser told him fawningly that the whole cabinet was 100% behind him.
